author: Special Correspondent
text:
Mohammed Abdul Rahim Qureshi, assistant general secretary and spokesman of All India Muslim Personal Law Board, died here on Thursday at the age of 81 following a cardiac arrest. He was admitted to a private hospital 15 days ago.

His funeral prayer, Namaz-e-Janaza, was conducted at Mecca Masjid.

Qureshi, an Islamic scholar, also held a B.Sc. degree in Mathematics and was a law graduate from Osmania University. After a short stint with the Accountant General’s office in Hyderabad, he joined the progressive cultural organisation, Tameer-e-Millat, which was founded in 1980. He has been a member of AIMPLB since 1971.

He was president of Tameer-e-Millat, that works in the field of educational and professional empowerment among Muslims, at the time of his death.
title: Muslim Personal Law Board spokesman dead
